Red Square is the main square of Moscow, located between the Moscow Kremlin and Kitay-gorod. The square appeared at the end of the 15th century when Ivan III ordered the demolition of all wooden buildings east of the Kremlin. The name "Red" means "beautiful" in Old Russian.

Area: 23,100 m²
Length: 330 m
Width: 70 m

Main attractions:
• St. Basil's Cathedral
• Lenin's Mausoleum
• GUM
• State Historical Museum
• Kazan Cathedral
• Lobnoye Mesto
Main square of Moscow, historical center of the city

St. Basil's Cathedral (Pokrovsky Cathedral) is an Orthodox church on Red Square, built in 1555–1561 by order of Ivan the Terrible in memory of the capture of Kazan.

Height: 65 m
Area: 1,600 m²

Architectural features:
• 9 churches on a single foundation
• Unique domes of different shapes and colors
• Rich interior decoration

Interesting facts:
• Initially, the temple was white and the domes were golden
• The modern bright coloring appeared in the 17th century
• According to legend, Ivan the Terrible blinded the architects so they could not build anything more beautiful

The Moscow Kremlin is the oldest part of Moscow, the main socio-political and historical-artistic complex of the city.

Area: 27.5 ha
Wall length: 2,235 m
Wall height: 5–19 m

Main objects:
• Assumption Cathedral (1475–1479)
• Annunciation Cathedral (1484–1489)
• Archangel Cathedral (1505–1508)
• Ivan the Great Bell Tower (1505–1508)
• Armory Chamber
• Diamond Fund

Interesting facts:
• First fortifications appeared in 1156
• Modern walls built in 1485–1495
• 20 towers, each with its own history
Historical complex in the center of Moscow

The State Tretyakov Gallery is the world's largest museum of Russian art.

Founded: 1856
Collection: over 180,000 works

Famous paintings:
• "The Appearance of Christ to the People" by A. Ivanov
• "Bogatyrs" by V. Vasnetsov
• "Morning in a Pine Forest" by I. Shishkin
• "Girl with Peaches" by V. Serov

Exhibition sections:
• Ancient Russian art
• 18th century art
• 19th century art
• 20th century art

Practical information:
• Address: Lavrushinsky Lane, 10
• Opening hours: Tue-Sun 10:00-21:00

The State Academic Bolshoi Theatre of Russia is one of the largest in Russia and one of the most significant opera and ballet theaters in the world.

Founded: 1776
Current building: 1825
Capacity: 2,153 seats

Architectural features:
• Famous Apollo's Quadriga on the pediment
• Eight-column portico
• Unique acoustics

Famous productions:
• "Swan Lake"
• "Spartacus"
• "Boris Godunov"
• "Prince Igor"

Practical information:
• Address: Theatre Square, 1
• Tickets are recommended to be purchased in advance
One of the leading opera and ballet theaters in the world

The State Department Store is a large shopping complex in the center of Moscow, occupying an entire block of Kitay-gorod and facing Red Square with its main facade.

Area: 35,000 m²
Floors: 3

History:
• Built in 1893
• Closed during Soviet times
• Reopened in 1953

Features:
• Unique architecture
• Glass roof
• Central fountains
• Over 200 stores

Practical information:
• Address: Red Square, 3
• Opening hours: 10:00-22:00
Historic shopping complex on Red Square

Lenin's Mausoleum is a memorial tomb on Red Square near the Kremlin wall, where the body of V. I. Lenin has been resting since 1924.

Height: 12 m
Area: 1,300 m²

Architectural features:
• Granite cladding
• Stepped form
• Speaker's platform

History:
• First wooden mausoleum built in 1924
• Modern stone mausoleum built in 1930
• Stalin's body was also kept here from 1953 to 1961

Alexander Garden is a park in the center of Moscow, located along the western wall of the Kremlin.

Area: 10 ha
Length: 865 m

Attractions:
• Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
• Fountain complex
• Italian Grotto
• Obelisk in honor of the 300th anniversary of the Romanov dynasty

History:
• Laid out in 1820-1823
• Named after Emperor Alexander I
• Reconstructed in 2012-2013
Historic park by the Kremlin walls

The Central Exhibition Hall "Manege" is the largest exhibition hall in the center of Moscow.

Area: 4,500 m²
Height: 15 m

History:
• Built in 1817
• Restored after the 2004 fire
• Modern reconstruction completed in 2005

Features:
• Unique column-free construction
• Modern exhibition equipment
• Central location

Practical information:
• Address: Manezhnaya Square, 1
• Opening hours: 12:00-22:00
Largest exhibition hall in central Moscow

The State Historical Museum is the largest national historical museum in Russia.

Area: 4,000 m²
Collection: over 4.5 million exhibits

Exhibitions:
• Ancient Rus
• Muscovite Tsardom
• Russian Empire
• Soviet period

Features:
• Unique building in pseudo-Russian style
• Rich interiors
• Interactive exhibits

Practical information:
• Address: Red Square, 1
• Opening hours: Mon-Sun 10:00-18:00

Kazan Cathedral is an Orthodox church on Red Square, a monument of Russian architecture of the 17th century.

Height: 42 m
Area: 1,200 m²

History:
• Built in 1625
• Destroyed in 1936
• Restored in 1990-1993

Architectural features:
• Tent roof
• Rich facade decoration
• Iconostasis in 17th century style

Practical information:
• Address: Red Square
• Opening hours: 8:00-20:00
